intro: Echium eriostachyum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Echium eriostachyum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
